messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: One of my swords
messages.msgSnippet: Hi there ( nice to share a name with us ) ? Good scans, the sword is out of polish and as such, will always be hard to identify form pictures. The rust on the
messages.messageBody:
Hi there ( nice to share a name with us ) ?

Good scans, the sword is out of polish and as such, will always be hard
to identify form pictures. The rust on the nakago ( tang ) looks to be
new and given the look of the yasurime ( file marks ) and the shape and
condition of the nakago, my immediate thought was Gendai. Looking at the
first image, with the long Chu kissaki and the low shinogi, I think this
is even more possible. If not gendai, then very late Edo or possibly
Meiji so maybe not Shinto, Shinshinto or later ( i.e Gendai )

Just for some general information, what you call a blade piece is in
fact a Habaki, the spacers are known as Seppa, the handle is a Tsuka.

Just my thought's here.

Rich




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: One of my swords
messages.msgSnippet: I m new here and I wanted to show everyone one of my swords.  It was given to me by my grandfather.  I think it is Shinto or Shinshinto. I ve been told both.
messages.messageBody:
I'm new here and I wanted to show everyone one of my swords. It was
given to me by my grandfather. I think it is Shinto or Shinshinto.
I've been told both. I've got lots more pics if anybody would like
to see them. I would love to hear any comments anyone here has.
Thanks
http://photos.groups.yahoo.com/group/nihontostudy/vwp?.dir=/swcollect
or2001&.src=gr&.dnm=My+Katana.jpg&.view=t&.done=http%
